Anatomy and Figure Drawings
While art had always been an interest of mine, and I had certainly picked up knowledge of perspective and proportions, I had never done a proper foundational introduction on them. In college I took a foundational class that let me explicitly practice those basics
Human Figure
Based off of observation of models, started with lines of action, followed by the positioning of the ribcage and pelvis, before refining other shapes.
Observational Drawings
A series of drawings from observation of models, looking to capture form and volume
click anywhere outside to close
Coding Basics
My CS education startied with the introductory courses at Brown, with the intro path that focused on understanding the fundamentals of how code was processed and good coding practices, as opposed to jumping into a language like Java.

Fundamentals

Solid foundations are incredibly important for any creator, and only ecome more so as the project gets more complicated

In both art and coding, I've done extensive work in developing a solid fundamental undertanding of the tools and concepts needed for creating

Anatomy and Figure

Through observation, study, and practice in both digital and traditional mediums I understand fundamentals of the human form and figure

Coding Basics

Study of the fundamentals of code, starting from functional programming and moving to object oriented skills

Modeling and Texturing

Fundamental 3D modeling and sculpting, including UV shell mapping and procedural textures

Illustration And Animation

I've had a passion for animation for as long as I can remember, and have always been creating things in my free time. While I initally drew more for personal reasons, I more recently branched out in a wide range of styles to expand what I can do, both personally and in communication with others in a professional setting.

Illustration

A collection of works in varying styles and resolutions

2D Animation

A collection of works comprised mostly of digitally hand-drawn animations

3D Animation

A collection of works comprised of animations made with Maya software

"Shoot for the moon. Even if you miss you'll land among the stars"

-Les Brown

Hi, I'm Anthony! I'm a student at Brown University studying computer science, focusing on visual computing.

This portfolio site showcases the experience and work I've done, ranging from traditional illustration to character rigging to game ai and everything in between.

Navigate using the stars at the top, and if you have questions about anything feel free to contact me at anthony_ragucci@brown.edu

Programming

As a CS student, I've done a lot of work in different languages and with differnt types of products, ranging from ones focused on artistry to others focused on functionality.

Web Design

Hand coded Html, Css, and Javascript websites, including the one you're on now!

Game Ai and Other Projects

A series of projects using functional programming

Rigging & Tech Art

This is where all of those previous experiences come together, and definitely where I get the most excited

2D Model Rigging

Aa model controlled with facial expressions, composed of 100+ 2D image layers

3D Model Rigging

3D character rigs from a project I worked on Fall 2022

Simulation and Physics
